name: Low fat milk, whole grain cereal and banana
ingredients: ⦁ 45g whole grain cereal (light 'n' tasty macadamia) ⦁ 1 large banana
category: egg free/ lupin free/ sesame free/soy free

name: Bread, cheese, poached egg and peach
ingredients: ⦁ 1 slice reduced fat Swiss cheese (5%) ⦁ 1 poached egg ⦁ 1 large peach
category: lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/soy free

name: Omelet and bread
ingredients: ⦁ 1 cup of mixed vegetables (e.g. tomato, mushrooms, onion, capsicums) ⦁ 2 tsp vegetable oil
preparation: Heat the oil in a saucepan and add the vegetables. Cook gently until everything is softened, remove from saucepan and set aside. Pour the beaten eggs into the pan, tilt the pan ever so slightly from one side to another to allow the eggs to swirl and cover the surface of the pan completely. Let the mixture cook until the egg has just set. Fill the omelet with vegetable mixture, scatter the filling over the top of the omelet and fold gently in half with the spatula. Slide onto a plate to serve.
category: lactose free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Low fat yogurt, whole grain cereal, dried currants and almonds
ingredients: ⦁ 45g whole grain cereal (light 'n' tasty macadamia) ⦁ 2 tbsp dried currants ⦁ 8 almonds
category: egg free/ lupin free/ sesame free/soy free

name: Low fat milk, bread, peanut butter and cranberries
ingredients: ⦁ 1 slice whole wheat bread ⦁ 1 tbsp peanut butter ⦁ 2 tbsp cranberries
category: egg free/ lupin free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Rice cakes, avocado, poached eggs and apple
ingredients: ⦁ 4 slices avocado (40g) ⦁ 2 poached eggs ⦁ 1 medium apple
category: gluten free/ lactose free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Overnight oats
ingredients: ⦁ 1 tbsp chia seeds ⦁ 1 tbsp peanut butter ⦁ 1 cup almond milk, unsweetened ⦁ 1 cup blueberries
preparation: Combine muesli and almond milk and let the mixture soak in the fridge for 2 hours or overnight. Stir in peanut butter, add blueberries and serve.
category: lactose freevegan

name: Banana pancakes
ingredients: ⦁ 1 banana ⦁ 1 whole egg ⦁ ¼ tsp ground cinnamon ⦁ 1 tbsp water
preparation: Whisk together banana, egg, cinnamon and water with a fork. Stir through crushed Weet-Bix™. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat, wipe or spray with a bit of oil. Scoop batter onto pan with a tablespoon. Cook pikelets 3 minutes, flip and cook a further 2–3 minutes until golden. Serve warm with yogurt and maple syrup.
category: nut free

name: Spinach frittata
ingredients: ⦁ 1 cup baby spinach ⦁ ¼ cup low fat milk (1%) ⦁ 2 tbsp grated Edam cheese (1oz.) ⦁ 2 tsp vegetable oil ⦁ 2 apricots
preparation: Whisk eggs with milk and set aside. Heat oil in a stick-free skillet on medium heat and add the chopped spinach. Once the spinach has wilted, spread the mixture out evenly on the pan. Pour the egg mixture over the spinach. Use a spatula to lift up the spinach mixture along the sides of the pan to let egg mixture flow underneath. Sprinkle with cheese and let the frittata cook until the eggs are set.
category: gluten free/nut free

name: Blueberry smoothie
ingredients: ⦁ 1 cup frozen blueberries ⦁ 1 cup frozen bananas ⦁ 1 tbsp almond butter ⦁ 6 chopped almonds (topping)
preparation: In a blender, combine all of the ingredients. Blend on low until the blender gains traction, then ramp up to the highest speed. Blend until the smoothie is completely creamy and serve.
category: gluten free/lactose freevegan

name: Greek salad
ingredients: ⦁ 15 small black olives ⦁ 90g feta cheese ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ 1 tbsp red wine vinegar ⦁ dried oregano
preparation: Cut the all the vegetables and place in a salad dish. Add the olives, oil and vinegar, season with dried oregano and toss gently. Add feta cheese in blocks and serve with crusty bread.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Zucchini and ricotta pizza with pita bread
ingredients: ⦁ 2 tbsp tomato paste ⦁ ½ cup grated mozzarella cheese ⦁ 60g ricotta cheese ⦁ 1 small zucchini ⦁ 10 cherry tomatoes ⦁ 5 stuffed green olives ⦁ fresh basil leaves
preparation: Sprinkle the Lebanese bread with half the mozzarella cheese and top with the ricotta cheese. Arrange the zucchini, tomato, stuffed olives and basil on top. Sprinkle with the remaining mozzarella cheese then spray with vegetable oil. Season. Bake directly on the oven racks for 10 minutes or until cheese is dark golden and base is crisp.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Minestrone soup
ingredients: ⦁ ½ celery stick ⦁ ½ carrot ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ 2 cups vegetable stock ⦁ ½ cup diced tomatoes ⦁ ½ cup boiled beans ⦁ 1/3 cup macaroni pasta uncooked ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ 3 tbsp grated parmesan cheese ⦁ fresh basil leaves
preparation: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion, celery and carrot and cook, stirring often, for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are soft and lightly golden. Add garlic. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Transfer to a pot, stir in stock, tomato and beans. Cover and cook on low for 15 minutes, then remove the lid and add the pasta. Stir to combine, cover and cook for a further 30 minutes or until pasta is al dente. Divide the soup among serving bowls, sprinkle with fresh basil and grated parmesan.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/soy freeMediterranean

name: Minestrone soup (gluten free)
ingredients: ⦁ ½ celery stick ⦁ ½ carrot ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ 2 cups vegetable stock ⦁ ½ cup diced tomatoes ⦁ 2/3 cup boiled beans ⦁ ½ cup gluten free macaroni pasta uncooked ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ 2 tbsp grated parmesan cheese ⦁ fresh basil leaves
preparation: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion, celery and carrot and cook, stirring often, for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are soft and lightly golden. Add garlic. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Transfer to a pot, stir in stock, tomato and beans. Cover and cook on low for 15 minutes, then remove the lid and add the pasta. Stir to combine, cover and cook for a further 30 minutes or until pasta is al dente. Divide the soup among serving bowls, sprinkle with fresh basil and grated parmesan.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Minestrone soup (lactose free)
ingredients: ⦁ ½ celery stick ⦁ ½ carrot ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ 2 cups vegetable stock ⦁ ½ cup diced tomatoes ⦁ 2/3 cup boiled beans ⦁ 1/3 cup macaroni pasta uncooked ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ fresh basil leaves
preparation: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion, celery and carrot and cook, stirring often, for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are soft and lightly golden. Add garlic. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Transfer to a pot, stir in stock, tomato and beans. Cover and cook on low for 15 minutes, then remove the lid and add the pasta. Stir to combine, cover and cook for a further 30 minutes or until pasta is al dente. Divide the soup among serving bowls, sprinkle with fresh basil and grated parmesan.
category: egg free/ lactose free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterraneanvegan

name: Indian oven baked potatoes
ingredients: ⦁ ½ onion ⦁ ¼ garlic clove ⦁ ½ tsp grated ginger ⦁ ¼ red chili pepper ⦁ ¼ tsp garam masala ⦁ ¼ ground turmeric ⦁ ¼ tsp ground cumin ⦁ ¼ tsp ground coriander ⦁ ½ sprig curry leaves ⦁ 10 cherry tomatoes ⦁ ½ cucumber ⦁ 4 tbsp low fat yogurt ⦁ 1 tsp chopped fresh mint ⦁ 4 tsp vegetable oil
preparation: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place the potato, onion, ginger, garlic, chili, if using, garam masala, turmeric, cumin, coriander, curry leaves and oil in a bowl. Season. Toss to combine. Arrange in a single layer on the lined tray. Roast, turning occasionally, for 35 minutes or until potato is golden brown and tender. Sprinkle with peas. Roast for 2 minutes or until peas are heated through. Meanwhile, to make the dressing, use your hands to squeeze as much liquid from cucumber as possible. Combine in a bowl with yogurt and mint. Season. Top the potato mixture with half the dressing. Sprinkle with the tomatoes. Serve immediately with the remaining dressing.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeAsian/ Oriental

name: Mushroom and goat cheese pasta salad
ingredients: ⦁ 1 cup white mushrooms ⦁ 2 small oyster mushrooms ⦁ ¼ garlic clove ⦁ ½ tsp lemon rind ⦁ 1 tsp lemon juice ⦁ ½ tbsp chopped chives ⦁ ½ cup rocket ⦁ 60g goat cheese ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil
preparation: Cook pasta following packet directions. Drain well. Meanwhile, heat half the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add mushrooms. Cook for 5 minutes or until golden and tender. Add garlic and lemon rind. Cook for a further 2 minutes. Combine lemon juice, chives and remaining oil in a small bowl. Add pasta to frying pan. Cook, tossing, for 1 minute or until heated through. Remove from heat. Add rocket and chives. Season with salt and pepper, toss to combine, top with cheese, sprinkle with extra chives and serve.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Mushroom and goat cheese pasta salad (gluten free)
ingredients: ⦁ 1 cup white mushrooms ⦁ 2 small oyster mushrooms ⦁ ¼ garlic clove ⦁ ½ tsp lemon rind ⦁ 1 tsp lemon juice ⦁ ½ tbsp chopped chives ⦁ ½ cup rocket ⦁ 60g goat cheese ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil
preparation: Cook pasta following packet directions. Drain well. Meanwhile, heat half the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add mushrooms. Cook for 5 minutes or until golden and tender. Add garlic and lemon rind. Cook for a further 2 minutes. Combine lemon juice, chives and remaining oil in a small bowl. Add pasta to frying pan. Cook, tossing, for 1 minute or until heated through. Remove from heat. Add rocket and chives. Season with salt and pepper, toss to combine, top with cheese, sprinkle with extra chives and serve.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Veggie and haloumi sandwich
ingredients: ⦁ ½ eggplant ⦁ ½ onion ⦁ 1 small zucchini ⦁ 2 slices haloumi cheese (60g) ⦁ 2 tsp olive oil ⦁ 1 tsp olive tapenade ⦁ 1 tsp pesto sauce ⦁ 1 tsp capers
preparation: Heat a chargrill pan over high heat. Lightly brush the eggplant, onion, zucchini and haloumi with oil. Grill eggplant and onion for 2 minutes each side or until tender. Grill zucchini on one side only for 2 minutes or until just tender. Grill haloumi for 2 minutes each side or until golden. Spread the tapenade over each slice of toast. Top with eggplant, haloumi, zucchini, onion and pesto sauce. Sprinkle with capers, drizzle with balsamic glaze and serve.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Cauliflower mac and cheese
ingredients: ⦁ 2/3 cup macaroni pasta uncooked ⦁ 80g ricotta cheese ⦁ 3 tbsp grated edam cheese ⦁ 1 pinch of nutmeg ⦁ ½ tsp chopped chives ⦁ ½ tsp chopped fresh basil leaves
preparation: Cook cauliflower in a saucepan of boiling water for 10 to 12 minutes or until tender. Using a large slotted spoon, transfer cauliflower to a large heatproof bowl. Add pasta to boiling water and cook following packet directions. Drain and return to pan. Meanwhile, using a stick blender, blend cauliflower until smooth. Add ricotta, edam cheese and nutmeg. Season with salt and pepper and stir until smooth and combined. Add cauliflower mixture to pasta. Stir to combine, sprinkle with chives and basil and serve.
category: egg free/lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Cauliflower mac and cheese (gluten free)
ingredients: ⦁ 2/3 cup gluten macaroni pasta, uncooked ⦁ 80g ricotta cheese ⦁ 3 tbsp grated edam cheese ⦁ 1 pinch of nutmeg ⦁ ½ tsp chopped chives ⦁ ½ tsp chopped fresh basil leaves
preparation: Cook cauliflower in a saucepan of boiling water for 10 to 12 minutes or until tender. Using a large slotted spoon, transfer cauliflower to a large heatproof bowl. Add pasta to boiling water and cook following packet directions. Drain and return to pan. Meanwhile, using a stick blender, blend cauliflower until smooth. Add ricotta, edam cheese and nutmeg. Season with salt and pepper and stir until smooth and combined. Add cauliflower mixture to pasta. Stir to combine, sprinkle with chives and basil and serve.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Mushroom and feta wraps
ingredients: ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ ¼ onion ⦁ ¼ red capsicum ⦁ ¼ yellow capsicum ⦁ 1 large whole meal tortilla wrap (~70g) ⦁ ¼ avocado (~35g) ⦁ ½ cup baby spinach ⦁ ½ tbsp parsley, chopped ⦁ 50g feta cheese
preparation: Preheat the grill on high. Line a baking tray with foil. Place the mushrooms with the cup side up, on the prepared tray. Combine half of the vegetable oil and half the garlic in a small bowl. Brush the garlic mixture over the mushroom cups to coat. Grill, turning halfway through cooking, for 6-8 minutes or until mushrooms are golden and tender. Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until tender. Add the capsicum and remaining garlic and cook, stirring, for 10 minutes or until starting to caramelize. Stir in the parsley. Cut the grilled mushrooms in half. Top each wrap with baby spinach, capsicum mixture and grilled mushroom. Add mashed avocado, sprinkle with feta cheese, fold up to enclose and serve.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Corn, tofu, spinach and egg noodle soup
ingredients: ⦁ ½ cup coconut milk ⦁ ¼ stalk lemongrass ⦁ 1-2 peppercorns ⦁ ¼ tbsp grated fresh ginger ⦁ ½ green spring onion ⦁ ½ large carrot ⦁ 4 ears of baby corn ⦁ ½ cup baby spinach ⦁ ¼ lime juiced ⦁ ½ cup tofu ⦁ 1 egg ⦁ 50g egg noodles, dry ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil
preparation: Pour the almond milk, coconut milk and vegetable stock into a saucepan. Add lemon grass and peppercorns, heat on a medium heat and bring to a simmer - do not boil rapidly. In another saucepan, heat the oil over a medium heat. Fry the onion and garlic for about 2-3 minutes until tender. Add carrot and cook for 5 minutes. Then add corn and tofu. Remove the lemongrass from the liquids before adding to the vegetables. Simmer for 5 minutes, but do not boil. Add spinach and lime juice and season to taste. Meanwhile, prepare the noodles. Heat a pan of water and bring to the boil before dropping in the noodles. Boil until tender or as per packet instructions. Drain, set aside. Divide the noodles between bowls, followed by the soup. Top with the slices of hardboiled egg and a few sprouts (optional).
category: lactose free/ lupin free/ sesame free/ soy freeAsian/ Oriental

name: Jacket potatoes with broccoli, chickpeas and yogurt dressing
ingredients: ⦁ 1/6 onion ⦁ ¼ garlic clove ⦁ 1 cup broccoli ⦁ 2/3 cup boiled chickpeas ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil ⦁ 2 tbsp low fat yogurt ⦁ 1 tbsp milk ⦁ ¼ tbsp lemon juice ⦁ ¼ garlic clove ⦁ ½ green spring onion ⦁ 1 tsp fresh parsley, chopped ⦁ 1 tsp fresh basil leaves, chopped
preparation:
Preheat the oven to 200°C. Rub the sweet potatoes lightly with vegetable oil then wrap each individually in aluminum foil. Bake for about 60 minutes, or until tender (a knife should glide easily into the center without resistance). Meanwhile, add the remaining vegetable oil to a medium skillet set over medium heat. When hot, add in the onion and cook for about 2 minutes, until it starts to soften. Stir in the garlic and cook for 30 seconds, until fragrant. Add in the broccoli and cook for about 3 to 5 minutes, until crisp tender. Remove from the heat and stir in the chickpeas, salt and pepper.
For the dressing: Add all of the ingredients for the dressing to the bowl of a food processor. Process until smooth, scraping down the bowl as needed. Add additional milk to smoothen the dressing if needed. Slice the sweet potatoes in half lengthwise. Sprinkle each with some salt and pepper, add the filling and top with the dressing.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/soy free

name: Cauliflower and tahini soup
ingredients: ⦁ ¼ onion ⦁ ½ celery stalk ⦁ 1 medium potato (210g) ⦁ ¼ garlic clove ⦁ ¼ tbsp ground coriander ⦁ ½ cup vegetable stock ⦁ 1 tbsp tahini ⦁ 1 tbsp pumpkin seeds ⦁ ½ tbsp sesame seeds ⦁ 1 tsp fresh coriander, chopped ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil
preparation: Preheat oven to 200°C. Place cauliflower on a baking tray lined with baking paper. Drizzle with vegetable oil and roast for 20 minutes or until golden and just tender. Stand for 2 minutes and chop. Heat the remaining oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until starting to soften. Add celery, potato and cauliflower. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until vegetables start to soften. Increase heat to high. Add ground coriander and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until fragrant. Add stock and 3/4 cup water. Stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper, cover and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes or until potato is tender. Remove from heat. Stand for 5 minutes. Add tahini to soup. Using a stick blender, blend soup until smooth. Heat remaining oil in a small frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook pumpkin and sesame seeds for 2 to 3 minutes or until sesame seeds are golden. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel to drain. Stir in lemon juice and coriander. Sprinkle with seed mixture and extra coriander.
category: egg free/ lactose free/ lupin free/ soy freevegan

name: Carrot salad with pistachios and feta cheese
ingredients: ⦁ 250g baby carrots ⦁ 90g feta cheese ⦁ ½ tbsp lemon juice ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ 1 tsp honey ⦁ 1 pinch ground cinnamon
preparation: Preheat oven to 180°C. Spread pistachios onto an oven tray and bake for about 4 minutes, until lightly toasted. Cool and roughly chop. Peel carrots and trim tops. Cook in a steamer for about 3 minutes, until just tender. Meanwhile, to make the dressing, combine all the ingredients in a small screw-top jar. Seal tightly and shake to combine. Toss warm carrots with half of the dressing. Arrange onto a serving platter, crumble feta over and sprinkle with the pistachios and coriander. Serve with the remaining dressing on the side.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Quinoa and grapefruit salad
ingredients: ⦁ ¼ grapefruit ⦁ ½ orange ⦁ 1/3 avocado (~45g) ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil ⦁ 1 tbsp pumpkin seeds ⦁ fresh basil leaves
preparation: Cook quinoa in a large saucepan of boiling water for 12 minutes or until tender. Drain. Rinse under cold water, drain and transfer to a bowl. Add grapefruit, orange, avocado, basil and oil to the quinoa. Season with salt and pepper. Toss gently to combine. Serve the salad sprinkled with pumpkin seeds.
category: gluten free/ lactose free/ lupin free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Grilled vegetable couscous
ingredients: ⦁ ½ zucchini ⦁ ¼ eggplant ⦁ ½ red capsicum ⦁ ½ tsp cumin seeds ⦁ ½ tsp fennel seeds ⦁ ¼ lemon, juiced ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ ¼ red chili pepper ⦁ 1 tbsp pine nuts ⦁ 1 tbsp dried currants ⦁ 30g feta cheese ⦁ 1 tsp coriander leaves, chopped
preparation: Place couscous in a bowl and pour over boiling water until it is covered. Cover with a clean towel and stand for 5 minutes or until couscous has absorbed the water. Fluff up grains with a fork. Heat a chargrill pan or barbecue on medium-high heat. Place vegetables in a large bowl and toss with the cumin and fennel seeds and oil until the vegetables are coated. Working in batches, cook vegetables for 2 minutes each side, until lightly charred and tender. Stir vegetables into couscous along with lemon juice, chili, pine nuts, dried currants and remaining oil. Stir in feta and coriander and serve with hummus.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Baked cheesy mushrooms
ingredients: ⦁ 3 slices mozzarella cheese ⦁ 1 cup baby spinach ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ ¼ tbsp fresh thyme leaves, chopped ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil ⦁ 1 tbsp balsamic vinegar ⦁ 1 tbsp grated parmesan cheese
preparation: Preheat oven to 220°C. Combine the oil, vinegar, garlic and chopped thyme in a small bowl. Season. Brush the mushrooms with a little of the oil mixture. Place on a lined baking tray, cut-side up. Divide the spinach among the mushrooms. Top with a little of the oil mixture. Top each mushroom with 1 slice of mozzarella cheese. Top with remaining oil mixture. Bake the mushrooms for 15 minutes or until the cheese is golden and melted and the mushrooms are tender. Transfer to a plate and serve.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Brown rice and egg salad
ingredients: ⦁ ½ cup green beans ⦁ ½ cup sweet peas ⦁ ¼ bunch chives, chopped ⦁ 2 eggs ⦁ 10 almonds ⦁ 2 tbsp reduced fat mayonnaise ⦁ 2 tsp vinegar ⦁ 1 tsp mustard
preparation: Place the egg in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes. Transfer egg to a bowl of cold water to cool. Peel and halve. Cook rice in a large saucepan of boiling water following packet directions, adding the beans and peas in the last 2 minutes of cooking. Rinse under cold water. Drain. To make the dressing, whisk the mayonnaise, vinegar, mustard, and 1 teaspoon water in a bowl. Combine the rice, beans, peas, chives and almonds in a large bowl. Drizzle over the dressing and top with egg.
category: gluten free/ lactose free/ lupin free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Vegetarian fajitas
ingredients: ⦁ fresh coriander, chopped ⦁ 1 large whole meal tortilla wrap (70g) ⦁ 1/3 avocado (~45g) ⦁ 2 tbsp light sour cream ⦁ ¼ red capsicum ⦁ ¼ yellow capsicum ⦁ ¼ onion ⦁ ¼ garlic clove ⦁ chili powder ⦁ smoked paprika ⦁ ground cumin ⦁ ¼ lime, juiced ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil
preparation: To make the fajita mix, take two or three strips from each color of pepper and finely chop them. Set aside. Heat the oil in a frying pan and fry the remaining pepper strips and the onion until soft and starting to brown at the edges. Cool slightly and mix in the chopped raw peppers. Add the garlic and cook for 1 min, then add the spices and stir. Cook for a couple of minutes more until the spices become aromatic, then add half the lime juice and season. Transfer to a dish, leaving any juices behind, and keep warm. Tip the black beans into the same pan then add the remaining lime juice and plenty of seasoning. Stir the beans around the pan to warm them through and help them absorb any flavors of the fajita mix, then stir through the coriander. Warm the tortillas in a microwave or in a low oven, then wrap them so they don’t dry out. Serve the tortillas with the fajita mix, beans, avocado and sour cream.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Carrot and lentil soup
ingredients: ⦁ 4 tbsp lentils uncooked ⦁ ½ tsp cumin seeds ⦁ 1 ½ cup vegetable stock ⦁ 1/6 cup milk ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil ⦁ 2 tbsp low fat yogurt
preparation: Heat a large saucepan cumin seeds for 1 min or until they start to jump around the pan and release their aromas. Add vegetable oil, grated carrots, red lentils vegetable stock and milk to the pan and bring to the boil. Simmer for 15 minutes until the lentils have swollen and softened. Whizz the soup with a stick blender or in a food processor until smooth (or leave it chunky if you prefer). Season to taste, top with yogurt and serve.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy free

name: Spicy rice and sweet potato biryani
ingredients: ⦁ ¼ cinnamon stick ⦁ 2 fresh curry leaves ⦁ ½ onion ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ 1 tsp fresh ginger, grated ⦁ ¼ tbsp coriander root, chopped ⦁ ¼ red chili pepper ⦁ ½ tsp garam masala ⦁ ¼ tsp turmeric ⦁ 1 cup sweet potato, grated ⦁ 1/3 cup basmati rice, uncooked ⦁ 2/3 cup vegetable stock ⦁ 2 eggs ⦁ 2 tsp butter ⦁ ½ tomato ⦁ 4 tbsp low fat yogurt
preparation: Heat the butter in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-low heat. Add the cumin and cinnamon and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Add the curry leaves and cook for 30 seconds or until aromatic. Add the onion and season with salt (optionally). Cook, stirring, for 3-4 minutes or until soft. Add the garlic, ginger, coriander and chili. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Add the garam masala and turmeric. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add the potato and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until well combined. Stir in the rice until coated. Stir in the stock. Reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, for 10 minutes or until the stock is absorbed. Remove the pan from heat. Use a spoon to make shallow indents in rice mixture. Crack 1 egg into each indent. Cook, covered, over low heat for 5-6 minutes or until white is just set but yolk is still runny. Serve with chopped tomato and yogurt.
category: gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeAsian/ Oriental

name: Pumpkin and lentil curry
ingredients: ⦁ ¼ onion ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ ½ tsp ginger, grated ⦁ ½ kaffir lime leaf, shredded ⦁ 1 tbsp red curry paste ⦁ ½ tbsp tomato paste ⦁ 1 cup white mushrooms ⦁ ½ tomato ⦁ ½ cup boiled lentils ⦁ ½ cup coconut milk ⦁ 1 cup pumpkin or butternut squash ⦁ 1 cup baby spinach
preparation: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 3-4 minutes until softened. Add the garlic, ginger, kaffir lime and curry and tomato pastes, and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. Add mushrooms and tomato in wedges, and cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes, then add the lentils and coconut milk. Add 30 ml water, increase heat to medium-high and bring to a simmer. Season and cook for 5-6 minutes until the flavors have infused. Add the pumpkin and cook for 10 minutes or until just tender. Stir through the spinach and cook for a further 1 minute or until wilted. Serve curry with rice and sprinkled with coriander and chili (optionally).
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lactose free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeAsian/ Orientalvegan

name: Lentil Bolognese
ingredients: ⦁ ¾ cup boiled lentils ⦁ 1 cup mixed vegetables (capsicum, carrot, celery, onion) ⦁ ½ cup white mushrooms ⦁ ½ cup tomato sauce ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ 2 tbsp grated parmesan cheese
preparation: Heat the oil in a large saucepan and add the vegetables. Cook gently for 15-20 minutes until everything is softened. Stir in the lentils, mushrooms and tomato sauce. Bring to a simmer and keep on a low heat while you cook the pasta, following pack instructions. Drain well, spoon sauce over the top, add grated parmesan and serve.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Lentil Bolognese (gluten free)
ingredients: ⦁ ¾ cup boiled lentils ⦁ 1 cup mixed vegetables (capsicum, carrot, celery, onion) ⦁ ½ cup white mushrooms ⦁ ½ cup tomato sauce ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ 1 tbsp grated parmesan cheese
preparation: Heat the oil in a large saucepan and add the vegetables. Cook gently for 15-20 minutes until everything is softened. Stir in the lentils, mushrooms and tomato sauce. Bring to a simmer and keep on a low heat while you cook the pasta, following pack instructions. Drain well, spoon sauce over the top, add grated parmesan and serve.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Asian market noodles
ingredients: ⦁ 1 cup mixed vegetables (onion, carrot, chili peppers) ⦁ 4 ears of baby corn ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ 1 cup Chinese cabbage ⦁ ½ cup bean sprouts ⦁ 1 egg ⦁ 1 tbsp gluten free soy sauce ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil ⦁ 12 peanuts
preparation: Place noodles in a heatproof bowl and cover with boiling water. Stand for 1-3 minutes, until almost tender. Drain, separate noodles and set aside. Heat a wok over high heat, add oil and heat until hot. Add onion and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until onion is just soft. Add garlic, carrot, corn and chili, stir-fry for 2 minutes and add cabbage. Stir-fry until combined. Toss through soy sauce and noodles. Swirl eggs over noodle mixture. Toss for 1 minute or until eggs set slightly. Spoon into a serving bowl. Top with bean sprouts, chopped peanuts and serve.
category: gluten free/ lactose free/ lupin free/ sesame freeAsian/ Oriental

name: Pumpkin and chickpea satay
ingredients: ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ ½ tsp fresh ginger ⦁ ¼ red chili pepper ⦁ 1 ½ cup pumpkin or butternut squash ⦁ ¼ cup coconut milk ⦁ 1/8 cup vegetable stock (30ml) ⦁ ½ cup cauliflower florets ⦁ 1 ½ tbsp peanut butter ⦁ 1 tsp gluten free soy sauce ⦁ ½ tsp honey ⦁ ¾ cup boiled chickpeas ⦁ ½ cup baby spinach ⦁ fresh coriander
preparation: Heat a large saucepan, add onion and cook for 4-5 minutes until soft. Add garlic, ginger and chili and cook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally. Add pumpkin and stir to combine. Pour in coconut milk and stock, and bring to the boil. Cover and reduce heat to simmer for 8-10 minutes until pumpkin is just cooked. Add cauliflower, cover and cook for 3-4 minutes until cauliflower is tender. Add peanut butter, soy sauce, honey and chickpeas. Stir to combine and heat through. Stir in coriander and baby spinach leaves. Serve with boiled rice.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lactose free/ lupin free/ sesame freeAsian/ Oriental

name: Broccoli and sweet potato couscous
ingredients: ⦁ 1 cup broccoli ⦁ 1/3 cup fresh corn kernels ⦁ 1/3 cup vegetable stock ⦁ 1/3 cup couscous ⦁ 1 tbsp pine nuts ⦁ ½ avocado (~70g) ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil ⦁ fresh mint ⦁ lemon juice (optional)
preparation: Preheat oven to 180°C. Place sweet potato onto baking tray. Spray with oil and bake for 15-20 minutes. Cut the broccoli into small florets. Steam broccoli and corn kernels. In a saucepan bring stock to the boil. Place couscous in a large bowl, pour heated stock over the couscous and rake with a fork. Let the couscous sit for 5 minutes then rake again. Mix in broccoli, corn kernels, sweet potato and pine nuts. Peel and cut the avocado into 2cm chunks and mix. Hand-pick mint leaves and scatter them through the couscous. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice and serve.
category: egg free/ lactose free/ lupin free/ sesame free/ soy freevegan

name: Quinoa pilaf with feta cheese
ingredients: ⦁ ¼ onion ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ 1/3 cup quinoa ⦁ 1/3 cup vegetable stock ⦁ 1/6 cup water ⦁ 1 cup broccoli ⦁ ¼ roasted red capsicum ⦁ ½ cup boiled chickpeas ⦁ 60g feta cheese ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ parsley ⦁ lemon zest
preparation: Heat half the oil in a large saucepan over high heat. Cook mushrooms, stirring occasionally, for 3-4 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate. Reduce heat to medium. Add remaining oil and onion to pan. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until soft. Stir in garlic for 1 minute or until aromatic. Add quinoa, stock and water. Bring to the boil and reduce heat to low. Simmer, covered, for 12 minutes or until water is almost absorbed. Stir in broccoli and cook, covered, for a further 2 minutes or until water is absorbed. Remove from heat and set aside, covered, for 3 minutes to steam. Stir mushroom, capsicum, chickpeas and parsley into the quinoa mixture and season with pepper. Sprinkle with feta and lemon zest and serve.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Saffron risotto with asparagus
ingredients: ⦁ 80g green asparagus (5 medium spears) ⦁ ½ cup long-grain rice ⦁ ¼ onion ⦁ 1/5 leek ⦁ ½ pinch saffron ⦁ ½ cup sweet peas ⦁ 2 tbsp grated parmesan cheese ⦁ 2 tsp butter ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil
preparation: Start by adding the saffron to a little bit of warm water and let it infuse for 30 minutes. Add the onion and vegetable oil to a large pan, let it cook slowly for about 10 minutes, until translucent. Bring the heat to medium, add the rice and stir constantly until the grains become transparent. Add the broth, topping the rice and mix once in a while. Repeat the last step as much as needed, about 4 times, until the rice is almost cooked. 5 minutes before the end, add the saffron, asparagus and peas. When the rice is to your liking, remove from the heat, add the butter and parmesan and serve.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Greek stuffed tomatoes
ingredients: ⦁ 1/3 cup long-grain rice ⦁ 1 small potato (170g) ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ 1/3 onion ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ fresh parsley
preparation: Wash tomatoes thoroughly and slice tops off. Using a spoon, gently remove tomato flesh and seeds. Place the flesh and seeds into a clean bowl. Place tomato shells in a lasagna baking dish in rows. In the bowl containing the seeds and flesh, add the garlic and onion. Blend until smooth. Place mixture back into the bowl, add rice, parsley, pepper and part of the vegetable oil. Mix ingredients together. Fill tomato shells with mixture, just to the top and reserve the remaining filling. Preheat oven to 200°C. Place potato wedges into the remaining tomato mixture and coat. Place a wedge between tomatoes in baking dish until all the spaces are filled. Pour remaining mixture over tomatoes and drizzle with remaining oil. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour. Remove foil when potatoes are soft and rice is fluffy and allow to cook for a further 10-15 minutes uncovered. Serve with feta cheese.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Vegetarian mousaka
ingredients: ⦁ ¼ onion ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ 1/3 cup boiled chickpeas ⦁ 1/3 cup boiled lentils ⦁ ½ cup crushed tomatoes ⦁ ½ cup diced tomatoes ⦁ 1 cup baby spinach ⦁ 2 tbsp low fat yogurt ⦁ 40g ricotta cheese ⦁ 25g feta cheese ⦁ 1 tbsp whole milk ⦁ 1/3 egg ⦁ 2 tbsp grated edam cheese ⦁ 2 tsp olive oil ⦁ dried parsley ⦁ dried oregano ⦁ ground coriander
preparation: Preheat oven to 200°C. Brush a baking sheet with a little bit of vegetable oil and then arrange the eggplant cut in slices on it. Brush the tops of the slices with vegetable oil, sprinkle with pepper and bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, flipping the slices once halfway through cooking, until the eggplant is softened and slightly golden. Remove and let cool until ready to use. Once eggplant is out of the oven, lower temperature to 180°C. While the eggplant is in the oven, place the cooked chickpeas and lentils in the food processor and process on pulse until they reach a coarse grain consistency. Set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan set over medium heat, add the onion and garlic and cook for 3-4 minutes, until softened and fragrant. Add the tomatoes (crushed and diced), chickpeas and lentils, parsley, oregano, coriander and pepper. Stir well, bring to a simmer, cover and simmer gently for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring from time to time. Then, stir in spinach leaves and cook until just wilted. Remove from heat. Spread a thin layer of the sauce at the bottom of a baking dish then arrange a layer of eggplant slices over it. Cover with more sauce, followed by another layer of eggplant slices. Repeat one more time then cover your final layer of eggplant with a thin layer of tomato sauce. In your food processor, combine the yogurt, ricotta cheese, feta cheese, milk, eggs and pepper. Process on high until well blended then pour the mixture over the final layer of tomato sauce. Sprinkle with the grated cheese and bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, until the top is golden brown. Take the mousaka out of the oven, allow it to rest for 5 to 10 minutes and serve.
category: gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Pineapple stir fry
ingredients: ⦁ 1 cup red and white cabbage ⦁ ½ cup broccoli ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ 2 tbsp pineapple juice ⦁ 2 tsp gluten free soy sauce ⦁ 1 tsp rice vinegar ⦁ ½ tbsp honey ⦁ ½ cup pineapple chunks ⦁ 10 cashew nuts ⦁ fresh coriander ⦁ 2 tsp vegetable oil
preparation: Boil the rice following pack instructions. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large wok and add the garlic and mixed vegetables. Cook over a medium heat, stirring often. While the vegetables are cooking, combine the pineapple juice, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey and a little black pepper in a jug, and mix well. When the vegetables are just tender, add the pineapple chunks and cashews along with the sauce. Continue to cook for a couple of minutes longer until everything is warmed through. Drain the rice and add it to the stir fry and serve topped with some fresh coriander.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lactose free/ .lupin free/ sesame freeAsian/ Oriental

name: Chickpea and coconut curry
ingredients: ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ ½ tsp fresh ginger ⦁ ¼ red chili pepper ⦁ ½ tsp mustard seeds ⦁ ½ tsp curry powder ⦁ 2 fresh curry leaves ⦁ 1/3 cup vegetable stock ⦁ 30ml (1/8 cup) coconut milk ⦁ 1 large carrot ⦁ 2/3 cup boiled chickpeas ⦁ 1/3 cup sweet peas ⦁ 2 tsp vegetable oil ⦁ ½ cup steamed quinoa ⦁ 2 tbsp low fat yogurt
preparation: Heat oil in a saucepan over high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until soft. Add garlic, ginger, chili, spices and curry leaves and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add vegetable stock and coconut milk and bring to boil. Add carrot and chickpeas, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes. Add broccoli and peas and simmer, covered, for 5 minutes or until veggies are just tender. Serve with quinoa, yogurt and top with coriander, if desired.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/sesame free/ soy freeAsian/ Oriental

name: Pasta salad with beans and pesto
ingredients: ⦁ 10 cherry tomatoes ⦁ 1 cup green beans ⦁ 2/3 cup baked tofu ⦁ 2 tbsp grated parmesan cheese ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ 1 tbsp pesto sauce
preparation: Preheat oven to 170°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place the tomatoes, cut side up, on the prepared tray, spray with vegetable oil and roast for 15 minutes or until softened slightly. Set aside to cool. Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large saucepan of lightly salted boiling water following pack instructions, adding the beans in the last 2 minutes of cooking. Transfer to a colander and refresh under cold running water. Drain well. Transfer pasta and beans to a large bowl. Add the tofu, tomatoes, parmesan, basil pesto and basil leaves. Season with pepper. Toss to combine and serve.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Pasta salad with beans and pesto (gluten free)
ingredients: ⦁ 10 cherry tomatoes ⦁ 1 cup green beans ⦁ 2/3 cup baked tofu ⦁ 1 tbsp grated parmesan cheese ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ 1 tbsp pesto sauce
preparation: Preheat oven to 170°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place the tomatoes, cut side up, on the prepared tray, spray with vegetable oil and roast for 15 minutes or until softened slightly. Set aside to cool. Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large saucepan of lightly salted boiling water following pack instructions, adding the beans in the last 2 minutes of cooking. Transfer to a colander and refresh under cold running water. Drain well. Transfer pasta and beans to a large bowl. Add the tomatoes, parmesan, basil pesto and basil leaves. Season with pepper. Toss to combine and serve.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Chickpeas with spinach
ingredients: ⦁ 1 cup boiled chickpeas ⦁ 1 garlic clove ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ sweet paprika ⦁ 60g feta cheese (to serve, as accompaniment)
preparation: Cook the garlic in a saucepan with a little bit of vegetable oil over medium heat until golden brown. Add the paprika, stir and add the spinach, finely chopped. Add water and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the cooked chickpeas, stir, add more paprika if you want and cook for 5 minutes more. Serve with feta cheese and toasted bread.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Mushroom & potato soup
ingredients: ⦁ 2 cups white mushrooms ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ 1 large potato (370g) ⦁ 1 large carrot ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ 1 cup vegetable stock ⦁ 2 tbsp light sour cream ⦁ 4 walnuts ⦁ fresh thyme ⦁ fresh parsley
preparation: Peel the potatoes and cut them into little cubes. Heat the oil in a large pan, add the onions and cook for 10 minutes until golden. Add the mushrooms and let them cook for another 2 minutes. Add hot stock, potatoes and carrots and boil for 20 minutes. Reduce the heat and add the fresh cream, letting the soup cook for another 2 minutes. Stir in thyme, parsley and pepper. Ladle into a bowl and serve topped with yogurt and chopped walnuts.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Couscous & haloumi salad
ingredients: ⦁ ¼ cup vegetable stock ⦁ 1 small zucchini ⦁ 10 cherry tomatoes ⦁ 2 slices haloumi cheese (60g) ⦁ 2 tsp olive oil ⦁ 1 tbsp lime juice ⦁ ½ garlic clove
preparation: Tip the couscous into a bowl, pour the boiling stock over and mix well with a fork. Cover with a plate and leave for 4 minutes. Meanwhile, tip all the dressing ingredients into a bowl and mix well. Fluff up the couscous with a fork and stir in half the dressing. Mix well and pile on to a serving dish. Heat the vegetable oil in a frying pan and cook the zucchini cut in slices over a high heat for 2-3 minutes until dark golden brown. Lift out on to kitchen paper. Put the tomatoes cut-side down into the pan, and cook for another couple of minutes until tinged brown on the underside. Top the couscous with the zucchini slices and then the tomatoes. In the same pan, add the haloumi strips and cook for 2-3 minutes, turning them over from time to time, until crisp and sizzled brown. Pile on top of the tomatoes, drizzle with the remaining dressing and serve.
category: egg free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Tomato and mascarpone gnocchi
ingredients: ⦁ ½ cup tomato sauce ⦁ 1 cup baby spinach ⦁ 1 tbsp mascarpone cheese ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ 2 tbsp grated parmesan cheese
preparation: Heat the grill to medium. Cook the gnocchi in a pan of boiling water following pack instructions, then drain. Meanwhile, heat the tomato sauce in a pan and add the spinach, stirring until wilted. Add the gnocchi to the sauce, season and tip into a heatproof dish. Spoon balls of mascarpone over. Scatter with the grated cheese and grill until golden.
category: gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Lentil burger
ingredients: ⦁ ½ cup boiled lentils ⦁ ¼ carrot ⦁ ¼ egg ⦁ 1 tsp dried breadcrumbs ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil ⦁ ground cumin ⦁ 1 whole wheat burger bun ⦁ 2 tbsp hummus, to serve ⦁ 2 tomato slices, to serve ⦁ 1 lettuce leaf, to serve
preparation: Heat half the oil in a large frying pan on high heat. Cook onion for 4-5 minutes, until tender. Stir in cumin and cook for 1 minute, stirring, until fragrant. Set aside to cool. Place lentils in a food processor, process until almost smooth and transfer to a bowl. Stir through carrot, egg and breadcrumbs. Season to taste. Shape mixture into patties. Cover and chill for 20 minutes, until firm. Heat remaining oil in the same pan on medium heat. Cook patties, for 2-3 minutes each side, until golden. Drain on paper towel. Spread one half of the burger bun with hummus. Top with beetroot, lettuce, patty and reserved onion. Top with remaining bread.
category: lactose free/ lupin free/ nut free/ soy free

name: Vegetarian paella
ingredients: ⦁ ½ garlic clove ⦁ 1/3 cup diced tomatoes ⦁ 1/3 cup brown rice uncooked ⦁ ½ cup boiled chickpeas ⦁ ½ cup vegetable broth ⦁ ½ cup artichoke hearts ⦁ ¼ roasted red capsicum ⦁ 5 small black olives ⦁ ¼ cup sweet peas ⦁ 1 tbsp olive oil ⦁ smoked paprika ⦁ fresh parsley ⦁ lemon juice ⦁ saffron threads (optional) ⦁ 2 tbsp grated parmesan cheese
preparation: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Heat half of the oil in a heatproof pan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until the onions are tender and translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the garlic and paprika and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in the tomatoes and cook until the mixture begins to darken and thicken slightly, about 2 minutes. Stir in the rice and cook until the grains are well coated with tomato mixture, about 1 minute. Stir in the chickpeas, broth and saffron (if using). Increase the heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a boil, stirring occasionally. Cover the pan and transfer it to the lower rack in the oven. Bake, undisturbed, until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, 50 to 55 minutes. Meanwhile, spread the artichoke and chopped olives on a baking sheet and roast on the upper rack of the oven, until the artichokes are tender and browned around the edges, about 40 to 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and let the vegetables cool for a few minutes. Add parsley and lemon juice and set aside. Sprinkle the peas and roasted vegetables over the baked rice, cover, and let the paella sit for 5 minutes. Garnish with a sprinkle of chopped parsley and serve.
category: egg free/ gluten free/ lupin free/ nut free/ sesame free/ soy freeMediterranean

name: Honey soy fried rice
ingredients: ⦁ 2 tsp gluten free soy sauce ⦁ ½ tsp honey ⦁ ½ egg ⦁ 1 green spring onion ⦁ 4 ears of baby corn ⦁ ½ carrot ⦁ ½ cup sweet peas ⦁ ¼ cup bean sprouts ⦁ 1 tbsp vegetable oil ⦁ 15 cashew nuts
preparation: Cook the rice, following pack instructions. Drain well. Refrigerate until cold. Whisk soy sauce and honey in a jug. Set aside. Heat half of the oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Swirl the eggs around the wok to form a thin omelet. Cook for 1 minute. Roll omelet and cook until just set. Place on a board and slice into thin strips. Heat remaining oil in wok over high heat. Add green onions and corn. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Add rice, carrot, peas and soy mixture. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until hot. Toss through bean sprouts, cashews and omelet strips. Spoon into a bowl and serve.
category: gluten free/ lactose free/ lupin free/ sesame freeAsian/ Oriental
